0.title: I want to play a superhero of Indian origin in Avengers: Taapsee Pannu
0.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she wants to play a superhero. "Please ask Marvel...this is the only wish list I have," she added. "I want to be a part of Avengers, I want to play...superhero of Indian origin. That’s all I'm trying to manifest. So if anyone tells me a way to go about it, I'll follow it," Taapsee said.

1.title: Nigerian arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh in Mumbai
1.article_body: Police said that a 32-year-old Nigerian national, Chukwuma Ogbonna Nwaeke, was arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh by Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of Mumbai crime branch. Nwaeke, who was moving suspiciously in Santacruz area, started running after seeing the police vehicle and was arrested after a chase, an official said, adding he was carrying a bag containing cocaine.

2.title: 4 women who tricked & robbed train passengers arrested in Aurangabad
2.article_body: Four women, who were a part of a notorious gang robbing long-distance railway passengers of their belongings, were arrested by Government Railway Police (GRP) crime branch in Aurangabad on Wednesday. Officers said the women would travel to Mumbai from Aurangabad every two or three days. "They would...board different, random long-distance trains pretending to be travelling alone," police said.

3.title: Ensure constant supply of sanitary pads in schools: HC to Delhi govt
3.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to ensure a constant supply of sanitary napkins to girl students in government-aided schools under the Kishori Yojana scheme. The Directorate of Education informed the court that an e-tender had been floated for this. School authorities had been given funds to procure sanitary napkins from the government's e-marketplace, DoE said.

4.title: Expecting 4 cr pilgrims to visit U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM
4.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said the government is expecting as many as four crore pilgrims to visit the state during the upcoming Kanwar Yatra. "We'll ensure a hassle-free journey for all," Dhami said, while speaking at Uttarakhand Startup Conclave and Grand Challenge 2022. "Pilgrims are partaking in the ongoing Char Dham Yatra in record-breaking numbers," he added.

5.title: Elephant birth blocks Kerala-Tamil Nadu road for 1 hour
5.article_body: A road connecting Kerala and Tamil Nadu in Idukki district was blocked for an hour as an elephant was giving birth in the middle of the road, a forest department official said. The road was blocked by the herd as the mother gave birth, preventing vehicular movement. After the mother walked away with her calf, the road was cleared.

6.title: 2 boys, aged 6 & 9, drown in a village pond in MP's Damoh district
6.article_body: Two minor boys, aged six and nine years, drowned in a village pond while they were playing in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh, police said on Wednesday. The boys had left their homes in the afternoon and did not return till late evening, after which their families started looking for them, police said. Their bodies were found floating in the pond.

7.title: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur arrested for making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki
7.article_body: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur was arrested on Wednesday, a day after a court in Punjab's Jalandhar rejected his anticipatory bail plea, for allegedly making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki on a TV show. His remarks had led to protests in Jalandhar, with members of Valmiki community also calling for a bandh on July 11.

8.title: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios charged with assaulting ex-girlfriend
8.article_body: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios will appear before a Canberra court next month after being charged with assaulting his ex-girlfriend last year, local police said on Tuesday. If found guilty, Kyrgios could face a maximum sentence of two years in prison, reports said. Kyrgios' lawyer confirmed that the 27-year-old will make a statement in due course.

9.title: Speech fabricated to weaken LDF: Saji after resigning as Kerala Minister
9.article_body: After resigning from the Kerala Cabinet, Saji Cherian said he never defamed the Constitution. "I have resigned and it's my personal decision...A particular part from the speech was taken and the media fabricated it to weaken the CPI(M) and the LDF," he said. Cherian resigned amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

10.title: Modi ji's gift to Indian households: KTR on LPG price hike
10.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government for the increase in gas cylinder prices and said it was Modi ji's gift to all Indian households. "LPG over ₹1,050. An increase again of ₹50," he tweeted. His comment comes after the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 today.

11.title: Landslide near Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra, no casualty reported
11.article_body: A landslide occurred on a road leading to the Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra's Satara district on Wednesday after heavy rains. No casualty was reported, according to officials of Satara district administration. "After receiving information, our team reached the spot and cleared the debris from the road," Public Works Department's executive engineer, Sanjay Sonawane, said.

12.title: Authorities nab 39 suspects over migrant smuggling on boats to UK
12.article_body: At least 39 suspects allegedly involved in the smuggling of migrants via boats to UK have been arrested by authorities in a Europe-wide operation. The suspects have been accused of smuggling as many as 10,000 people on small boats across English Channel to UK. Notably, this comes months after 27 UK-bound migrants drowned off France's coast after their boat capsized.

13.title: Dolo-650 manufacturer's Bengaluru office raided by Income Tax Department
13.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at the premises of Bengaluru-based pharmaceutical company Micro Labs Ltd, the manufacturers of Dolo-650 tablet, on charges of tax evasion, officials said. They added that the department is looking at financial documents, balance sheets and business distributor networks of the company as part of the searches.

14.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani have sensual chemistry in Shamshera: Karan Malhotra
14.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor in 'Shamshera', filmmaker Karan Malhotra said, "Ranbir and Vaani have sensual chemistry...Their characters were written in a way to show how attraction leads to love and how...their love blooms in crisis." "Our song 'Fitoor', will show their dynamic chemistry, and I hope people love how...gorgeous they look together," he said.

15.title: Tendulkar shares pic with Ranveer on his b'day, says 'Any guesses when this was clicked?'
15.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to share an old picture with actor Ranveer Singh on the occasion of his birthday on Wednesday. "Happy Birthday, Ranveer! Have a great year ahead. Found this picture of ours...Any guesses when this was clicked?" he wrote in the caption. The photo also features Ranveer's father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani.

16.title: Virat Kohli records his worst Test ranking in 6 years, drops out of top 10
16.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli has recorded his worst Test ranking in around six years after dropping out of the top 10. Kohli managed scores of 11 and 20 against England in the Edgbaston Test and dropped to the 13th position in the latest rankings for Test batters. The last time Kohli was ranked below 10 was in November 2016.

17.title: Junior can marry only after elder brother: Raghav Chadha to Punjab CM
17.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha extended his wishes to party colleague and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann ahead of his wedding. Sharing a photo with Mann, Chadha said junior's number comes only after elder brother. He added, "Best wishes to my [big brother] Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life." Mann will get married on Thursday.

18.title: Nepal's Finance Minister resigns amid parliamentary probe
18.article_body: Nepal's Finance Minister Janardan Sharma resigned on Wednesday after the formation of an 11-member parliamentary committee to probe allegations of unauthorised changes to the federal budget. Sharma is accused of inviting unauthorised persons to make changes to tax rates in the budget for fiscal year 2022-23. The changes were allegedly made a day before the budget was presented in Parliament.

19.title: PM Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades: Owaisi
19.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades. His response came after the Centre approved 80 foreign direct investment proposals from Chinese entities. "After restricting Chinese investments in India, Modi has now done a u-turn and started approving FDI proposals from China," he added.

20.title: Smoke detected inside IndiGo flight after landing in Indore
20.article_body: Smoke was detected in the cabin of a Raipur-Indore IndiGo flight after landing on Tuesday, the aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation said on Wednesday. All the passengers were able to deboard from the A320 Neo aircraft safely, and the incident is being investigated by DGCA, according to reports.

21.title: Complaint filed against Nawazuddin's wife for not paying dues of ₹31 lakh: Reports
21.article_body: A police complaint has reportedly been filed against Nawazuddin Siddiqui’s wife Aaliya Siddiqui by Manju Garhwal, co-producer of her debut production venture, over non-payment of Rs 31 lakh dues. In her complaint, Garhwal alleged she has been trying to communicate with Aaliya but she isn't responding. Manju also accused Aaliya of causing her mental agony and harassment, reports added.

22.title: Authorities order mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai, Beijing
22.article_body: Chinese authorities have ordered a new round of mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai and Beijing after the discovery of new cases in the two cities. This comes as tight restrictions remain in place in Hong Kong, Macao and some other Chinese cities. Notably, Shanghai had ended its strict coronavirus lockdown a few weeks ago.

23.title: Indian Coast Guard rescues 22 ship crew members near Gujarat coast
23.article_body: Indian Coast Guard on Wednesday rescued 22 crew members of a sinking ship off the coast of Gujarat, which was on its way to Karnataka from UAE. The crew members were rescued after they issued a distress alert as their ship, MT Global King, started flooding. Among those rescued are 20 Indians and one Pakistani and Sri Lankan national each.

24.title: We've become laboratory of human rights violations: WB Guv
24.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said that the state is becoming a laboratory of human rights violations and urged the Bengali intelligentsia to break their silence on the "decimation of democratic values". "The greatest threat to democracy and which we cannot allow to happen is extreme appeasement," he further added.

25.title: Headlines managed, economy mismanaged: Rahul after LPG price hike
25.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the price hike of LPG cylinders by ₹50 and accused the BJP government of managing headlines, but mismanaging the economy. He added that in 2014, inflation used to be the headline, but now there's no discussion of the LPG price hike, even when it has become costlier by ₹50.

26.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 3-day seminar on NEP in Varanasi on July 7
26.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate a three-day seminar on the implementation of the National Education Policy (NEP) across the country, in Varanasi on Thursday. The event, which is being organised by the Union Education Ministry, will see over 300 senior dignitaries in attendance. UP CM Yogi Adityanath and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan will be present on the occasion.

27.title: Woman passenger conceals 1kg gold in rectum, caught at Hyd airport
27.article_body: A woman passenger was caught by the Hyderabad Customs officials for trying to smuggle over 1kg of gold, officials said. The gold was valued at ₹64.38 lakh and was concealed in her rectum, which was later caught by the air intelligence unit of the Hyderabad Customs, reports said. Further investigation is underway, officials added.

28.title: Hyd woman accused of running brothels detained under PD Act
28.article_body: A woman who has been accused of running prostitution rings was detained under the Preventive Detention Act and was sent to Hyderabad's Chanchalguda prison. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat invoked the PD Act against the accused woman, who has been involving women and young girls from Mumbai, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and other regions into prostitution.

29.title: India's coal production rises 32.57% year-on-year in June 2022
29.article_body: The Ministry of Coal on Wednesday said that the coal production has risen by 32.57% to 67.59 million tonnes (MT) in June 2022 from 50.98 MT in June 2021. Likewise, coal-based power generation registered a growth of 26.58% in June 2022 as compared to June 2021. The overall power generation in June 2022 was 17.73% higher year-on-year, it added.

30.title: Food Ministry calls meeting of edible oil firms for reduction in prices
30.article_body: The Food Ministry has called a meeting on Wednesday with edible oil companies to discuss reduction in the MRPs of cooking oils, Food Secretary Sudhanshu Pandey said. He added, "We'll tell them to pass on the benefits of reduction in global prices...to consumers." In the last one month, global prices have reportedly fallen $300-$450 per tonnes of different edible oils.

31.title: Kerala Minister Saji Cherian resigns amid protest over anti-Constitution remark
31.article_body: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian on Wednesday announced his resignation from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution. He had said that the Indian Constitution endorses the exploitation and loot of the common people. He later expressed regret and said, "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted."

32.title: Passenger safety is paramount: Scindia as SpiceJet gets notice over snags
32.article_body: After the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) issued a show cause notice to SpiceJet over the recent malfunction incidents, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said passenger safety is paramount. "Even the smallest error hindering safety will be thoroughly investigated and course-corrected," he added. The airline has reported eight malfunction incidents in the last 18 days.

33.title: Nepotism refuses to leave me, I'm still cursed, trolled & abused for it: Karan
33.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar spoke about nepotism and revealed the topic refused to leave him. "It started on...(Koffee With Karan) and that's never the industry, it's never left social media, by and large, I'm still cursed, trolled, and abused for it," he said. "Now I'm not bothered. It went from annoyance to amusement. Now I'm amused every time," he added.

34.title: Voyager Digital files for bankruptcy, 2nd crypto firm to do so in days
34.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital has filed for Chapter 11 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows reorganisation of debts. In its filing, the US-headquartered firm estimated it had over 10,000 creditors, $1-$10 billion in assets and liabilities worth the same value. Last week, it issued a default notice to crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital, which later filed for bankruptcy.

35.title: Man flashes his private part at woman at Delhi metro station, arrested a month after her tweets
35.article_body: A man named Manav Agarwal has been arrested for allegedly flashing his private part at a woman at Delhi's Jor Bagh Metro Station, a month after her tweets about the ordeal were circulated on social media. "I asked [police] to do something...instead they started victim blaming me," she had claimed. Manav went to Nepal to escape arrest, police said.

36.title: Sports tech startup Hudle raises $1 million in Series A round
36.article_body: Hudle, a sports technology startup, has raised funding of $1 million as part of their ongoing Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures (IPV). Existing investors Survam Partners and Indian Angel Network also participated in the round. Hudle is a mobile app which enables people to book various sports activities in more than 750 venues across India.

37.title: VC firm Axilor Ventures launches second fund of $100 million
37.article_body: Venture Capital firm Axilor Ventures has announced the launch of its early-stage fund with a corpus of $100 million. The Category-I Axilor Technology Fund II (ATF-II) will fund early-stage startups. ATF-II has been set up as a 15-year fund to allow it to stay with seed companies longer, as per Ganapathy Venugopal, Co-founder and CEO of Axilor Ventures.

38.title: 11-yr-old Prathamesh from 'Shark Tank' demonstrates Braille gadget to PM
38.article_body: At the ongoing Digital India Week 2022, 11-year-old Prathamesh Sinha demonstrated a Braille self-learning gadget called Annie to PM Narendra Modi. Annie is a product of Anand Mahindra-backed Thinkerbell Labs. The visually-impaired child, who was the youngest contestant of 'Shark Tank India', introduced himself to the PM as the company's brand ambassador. The PM praised him for his confidence.

39.title: Russia signs pact to supply tech for Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant
39.article_body: A unit of Russia's state-owned nuclear energy corporation Rosatom has signed a deal to supply state-of-the-art tech for Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant (KNPP) in Tamil Nadu, The Economic Times reported. As per Rosatom, the deal is for supplying thermocouples (temperature measuring transducers) for four units of KNPP. In total, it will supply 200 units of resistance thermocouples labelled TSPT 5963.

40.title: 4 held for stealing laptops from B'luru store, 110 laptops seized
40.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested four persons who were involved in stealing laptops from a computer store, the city's police informed on its official Twitter handle on Wednesday. Moreover, the police informed that 110 laptops of different brands, estimated to be worth around ₹5 lakh, have been seized from their possession. Further investigation into the matter is underway, police added.

41.title: RCP Singh resigns as minister from PM Modi's Cabinet
41.article_body: RCP Singh submitted his resignation as the Union Minister of Steel to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday. Singh is a minister in the Modi Cabinet from the JD(U) quota. Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has also resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs. This comes a day ahead of their Rajya Sabha term getting over.

42.title: IIT Guwahati designs electricity-free cooler as alternative to ACs
42.article_body: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have developed a passive radiative cooler which can operate without electricity. The cooling system can be applied on rooftops and can function both during day and night time. The cooler requires no external energy sources for its operation and can work as an alternative to conventional air conditioners to cool buildings and automobiles, the institute said.

43.title: If audiences like me, they'll watch a film irrespective of language: Nithya
43.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen, who worked in Malayalam, Telugu, Tamil and Hindi films, said her fans often ask her to star in a movie of their language. "Every time you see the comments, they'll say when are you doing...film in this language?" she added. "I feel, if you like me, watch it" "I wish people didn't feel like that," she said.

44.title: 4 of electronics firm booked for cheating supplier of ₹1.18 cr in Thane
44.article_body: Four directors of a Delhi-based electronics company were booked for allegedly cheating a supplier from Thane of over ₹1.18 crore, police said. The accused had placed an order for 10,000 street lights with the victim's company in 2019. They paid ₹59 lakh, but failed to pay the remaining sum, which with the interest worked out to ₹1.18 crore, police added.

45.title: Assam, Meghalaya recorded highest June rainfall since 1966: IMD
45.article_body: India Meteorological Department has said that Assam and Meghalaya recorded the highest June rainfall since 1966. According to IMD's climate summary, Assam and Meghalaya recorded 858.1 mm rainfall in June, breaking the earlier record of 789.5 mm in 1966. It's also estimated that over 190 persons died and 50 went missing due to landslides and heavy rain in June.

46.title: B'luru to get its first animal waste processing plant soon: Report
46.article_body: A task force set up by Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali along with the local administration has decided to build Bengaluru's first animal waste processing plant to tackle the issue of unmanaged animal waste, reports said. The initial capacity of the plant will be 20 tonnes. The plant is being built in three phases at a cost of ₹15-18 crore.

47.title: Lightning strikes kill 3 in separate incidents in Rajasthan's Bundi
47.article_body: Three people were killed in lightning strikes in two separate incidents in Rajasthan's Bundi, police said on Wednesday. A 65-year-old man, Banwari Mehar, and his 60-year-old wife Nandudevi of Balkasa village were killed on Tuesday after lightning struck them while they were working in a field, police said. In a similar incident, 65-year-old Gyarsibai Dhakad was killed in Kethooda village.

48.title: Ensure potholes are repaired: Maha CM after biker's death in Thane
48.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday reprimanded officials after a 37-year-old man was run over by a bus after his motorcycle bumped into a pothole in Thane. During a meeting with the municipal corporations across the Thane district, CM Shinde asked officials to ensure that the potholes are repaired. "Officials should go out on...field and survey the roads," he added.

49.title: BBMP chief inspects major junctions in B'luru to decongest traffic
49.article_body: BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath, along with Additional Chief Secretary to state government Rakesh Singh, on Tuesday conducted a joint inspection to chalk out plans to decongest major junctions in Bengaluru. The officials inspected Sarakki junction, junction near Jayadeva hospital and Central Silk Board junction. They instructed BESCOM to remove name plates to make way for pedestrians.

50.title: Tuition teacher assaults 5-year-old child in Patna, arrested
50.article_body: Police on Wednesday arrested a man, who runs a private coaching institute in Patna, for allegedly beating up a five-year-old student. The accused, identified as Amar Kant, assaulted the boy until he lost consciousness, police said. Kant, who was absconding after the child's parents filed a complaint, was caught and booked under relevant sections of IPC and Juvenile Justice Act.

51.title: Govt reduces gap for COVID-19 precaution dose from 9 months to 6 months for all above 18
51.article_body: Government has reduced the duration between second dose of COVID-19 vaccine and precaution dose from the existing 9 months to 6 months for all beneficiaries above the age of 18. For beneficiaries aged 60 and above, as well as health care workers and frontline workers, precaution dose would be administered after completion of 6 months, free of charge.

52.title: Cong MP says ₹1.50-lakh pen lost at Yashwant Sinha's event, files complaint
52.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress MP Vijay Vasanth has filed a police complaint that his pen worth ₹1.50 lakh has been missing since he attended an event for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha in Chennai. He said his late father H Vasantha Kumar, who was MP from Kanniyakumari, had given him the pen. He added the pen was very special to him.

53.title: Taken aback by attack on Moitra; urge people to 'lighten up': Tharoor
53.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said he is "taken aback by the attack" on Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra for her comments on Goddess Kaali. He also urged people to "lighten up and leave religion" to individuals to practise privately. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra had previously said.

54.title: 2 house burglars caught in B'luru; ₹1.7 lakh cash recovered
54.article_body: Police have arrested two persons for their alleged involvement in a house burglary in Bengaluru. Police officials have recovered ₹1.7 lakh cash and 272 grams of gold jewellery and 997 grams of silver ornaments worth ₹16 lakh from their possession, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Laxman Nimbargi said. Nimbargi also shared a picture of the recovered items.

55.title: Underwater drones that can carry 200 kg of drugs seized in Spain
55.article_body: Spanish police have seized three underwater drones used by drug traffickers to ship narcotics across the Strait of Gibraltar into Spain, Interior Ministry said. The sea-borne devices were designed to carry up to 200 kg of drugs. Spanish police said it was the first time they've seized such devices. Police have arrested eight people as part of the 14-month investigation.

56.title: 2 sent to judicial custody for assaulting lady constable in Gurugram
56.article_body: Two persons were produced in a city court on Tuesday and sent into judicial custody for allegedly misbehaving, manhandling and abusing a lady head constable in Gurugram. The incident happened in the premises of sector 40 police station. The accused had arrived at the police station with a man to file a complaint against him for stealing their scooty.

57.title: Iran methodically basing itself in Red Sea: Israel Defence Min
57.article_body: Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz on Tuesday said that "Iran is methodically basing itself in the Red Sea, with the greatest presence seen over the past decade". "It's a direct threat to international trade, energy supply, and the global economy," he added. The Defence Minister also released satellite pictures of four Iranian warships allegedly patrolling the Red Sea.

58.title: China seeks new golden era of ties with Philippines: Chinese Min
58.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Wednesday said that China is ready to work with new Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr to "open a new golden era" in the bilateral relationship. "I am grateful to Minister Wang Yi for extending the message of congratulations and support from President Xi Jinping," Marcos Jr tweeted after his meeting with the Foreign Minister.

59.title: I'll never pressurise anyone: Karan on Ranbir refusing to appear on 'Koffee...'
59.article_body: When asked about why actor Ranbir Kapoor refused to appear on his show 'Koffee With Karan 7', despite being a good friend, filmmaker Karan Johar said, "[Ranbir] said, 'I'm not coming, kuch gadbad ho jayega, it'll stay with me for life'." "I'll never pressurise anybody, because I feel you have to come off your own free will," he added.

60.title: Suspected thief injured in police firing in Assam's Kokrajhar
60.article_body: A suspected thief was injured in police firing in Assam's Kokrajhar district, police said on Wednesday. The accused tried to snatch the pistol of an officer and run away, police said, adding that he was hospitalised. With this, 54 people have been killed and at least 140 others injured in police action while trying to flee custody since May 2021.

61.title: Emergency declared in Balochistan's Quetta as heavy rains kill 25
61.article_body: At least 25 people were killed and several others injured due to heavy rainfall and flash floods in Balochistan over the last two days. Pakistan's Provincial Disaster Management Authority has declared an Emergency in the Quetta district. According to officials, as many as 50 mud houses collapsed in the Sariab Mills area, Eastern Bypass and other places.

62.title: Alstom wins Bhopal, Indore metro rail project order worth ₹3,200 cr
62.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MPMRCL) has awarded France-based Alstom an order worth ₹3,200 crore to deliver 156 Movia metro cars for Bhopal and Indore metro rail projects. The contract also includes comprehensive maintenance and installation of latest generation of Communications Based Train Control (CBTC) signalling system. The trains will be built at Alstom's Gujarat facility.

63.title: IAS officer Tina Dabi takes charge as Jaisalmer Collector, shares pics from new office
63.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, a UPSC 2015 exam topper, on Wednesday took charge as the District Collector and Magistrate of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan. Dabi, who was earlier posted in Jaipur as a joint secretary in the finance department of Rajasthan government, shared the news on social media with pictures of herself working in her new office.

64.title: JP Morgan cuts price target for Tesla as deliveries drop for 1st time in 2 yrs
64.article_body: JP Morgan analysts cut their price target for Tesla shares by $10 to $385 as it reported fall in deliveries for the first time in two years. The analysts said Tesla's production and financial results could be affected by execution issues at its new factories in Texas and Berlin. Recently, CEO Elon Musk described both factories as "gigantic money furnaces".

65.title: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigns as Union Minister of Minority Affairs
65.article_body: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs on Wednesday, ANI reported. His term as Rajya Sabha MP is set to end soon. The resignation comes hours after reports claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised him at the Cabinet meeting for his contribution to the country and people.

66.title: I had to sell my office due to the COVID-19 pandemic: Ram Gopal Varma
66.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he had to sell his office because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Talking about his films not doing well during the COVID-19 pandemic, the filmmaker who directed 'Satya' stated, "During this time, a lot of films by a lot of people [haven't] done well. It is not just about my films, but no one targets others."

67.title: Lees used to bat like Boycott, but now he's batting aggressively: Vaughan
67.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said England batters are changing their batting style according to the new 'aggressive' approach of captain Ben Stokes and Test head coach Brendon McCullum. "Players like Alex Lees, who only 6 weeks ago was batting like Geoffrey Boycott, wanted to bat for long periods of time...has [now] come out batting aggressively," explained Vaughan.

68.title: Business is currently firm for our chip industry: Taiwan amid slowdown
68.article_body: Taiwan's Economy Minister Wang Mei-hua said on Wednesday that the business for the country's semiconductor industry is currently "firm". The order books of Taiwan's chip firms "are still very full", she added. Her assurance came after American chip manufacturer Micron Technology said last week that the chip market had "weakened considerably in a very short period of time".

69.title: Congress denied probe into Shyama Prasad Mukherjee's death: JP Nadda
69.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, on the birth anniversary of Shyama Prasad Mukherjee, said the Congress denied an inquiry into the "mysterious" death of the leader. "Only Congress and Nehru know why...inquiry was not conducted," Nadda added. He further lauded PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah for scrapping Article 370 in J&K, calling it a "true tribute" to Mukherjee.

70.title: Delhi Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah joins BJP
70.article_body: Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah, who was an MLA for three terms in the Delhi Assembly, joined the BJP on Wednesday. Speaking to reporters, Marwah criticised Congress leadership for allegedly ignoring longtime members and appealed to all the G-23 leaders of Congress to join BJP. He further praised PM Narendra Modi, saying that there has been no PM like him.

71.title: TRS leader celebrates birthday on Hyderabad road, causes traffic jam
71.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi leader and former Hyderabad mayor Bonthu Rammohan and his supporters played music and burst crackers to celebrate his birthday on a road in Hyderabad. Reports said that the celebrations caused a traffic jam and blocked the way for commuters. The TRS leader reportedly sprayed champagne before brandishing handheld crackers in both hands, Times Now reported.

72.title: How can India still qualify for World Test Championship final?
72.article_body: India are currently fourth on WTC points table. India can take their percentage of points won to 68.05% if they win each of their remaining six fixtures. India would need to beat Australia 4-0 and expect them to lose at least four more matches for a better chance to qualify. India would also need South Africa to lose three matches.

73.title: Always been in awe of your kindness: Madhavan on Hrithik's Rocketry tweet
73.article_body: Reacting to Hrithik Roshan's tweet on actor R Madhavan's recent film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', the latter tweeted, "I have always been in awe of your kindness bro..but this is another level." "It means the world to...[me]. You will always be my special hero," added Madhavan. "The brilliant word-of-mouth for Rocketry...has left me with FOMO!" read the tweet from Hrithik.

74.title: I bury face in pillow, can't see his pic without breaking down: Saira on Dilip
74.article_body: Ahead of late actor Dilip Kumar's death anniversary, his wife Saira Banu said she cannot look at the late actor's picture without breaking down. "I...bury my face in the pillow and try to go back to sleep... as if by doing so I will...see him sleeping by my side...Not a moment passes...when he is not before my eyes," she added.

75.title: LPG costliest for Indians while unemployment at peak: Varun Gandhi
75.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said that at a time when unemployment is at its peak, Indians have to buy LPG at the highest price in the world. The statement comes after domestic LPG cylinder's price was increased by ₹50. "The connection cost increased from ₹1,450 to ₹2,200," Gandhi said. "The poor's kitchen is filling with smoke again," he added.

76.title: Spirit of our culture can't be trivialised by anybody: Singhvi on Mahua's remark
76.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi reacted to TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali, saying that people must be careful when they "play" with emotions of people, which are reflected in such symbols, culture and faith. "Heart and spirit of our culture cannot be trivialised by anybody, anywhere be it elsewhere, abroad or here," he added.

77.title: B'luru college students complain of overflowing toilet waste on campus
77.article_body: The students of Bengaluru's Sri Jayachamarajendra Polytechnic College have complained of overflowing toilet waste near the campus gate, canteen and classrooms. A student said, "Stinking smell from the toilet waste is unbearable...It's difficult to focus on classroom teaching." Meanwhile, the NSUI has submitted a report to the Principal Secretary of Higher Education, seeking immediate intervention.

78.title: Ruturaj won't get opportunity in 1st England T20I: Aakash Chopra
78.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad is unlikely to feature in India's XI for the first T20I against England. "Rohit is back...Who goes out? Ruturaj won't get another opportunity but will Sanju Samson retain his place?" asked Aakash. Ruturaj scored 3 runs in the first T20 warm-up game against Derbyshire. The first T20I will be played on Thursday.

79.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an Eknath Shinde: State BJP chief Annamalai
79.article_body: Following a change of regime in Maharashtra, state BJP chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also gearing up for a cabinet shuffle. "Tamil Nadu cabinet headed by DMK leader M K Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he claimed. DMK, however, described Annamalai's comments as "insignificant" and said "the party is not taking him seriously".

80.title: ED summons crypto exchanges, seeks info under FEMA: Reports
80.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED), which is probing alleged instances of foreign exchange violations, has summoned CoinSwitch Kuber, CoinDCX and other crypto exchanges in the case, as per reports. The agency is reportedly seeking details like transaction history under Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). "ED is examining every detail on offshore transactions," an official told The Economic Times.

81.title: Tibetan issue not only political matter but matter of truth: Dalai Lama
81.article_body: Tibetan issue is not only a political matter but a matter of truth, Dalai Lama said on Wednesday. "What we have is truth on our side," he added. "We have not been telling lies. We have been sincere in our struggle. So, for all these years I've worked sincerely, respecting law," he stated.

82.title: Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight lands at Delhi airport on a single engine, passengers safe
82.article_body: A Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight landed at Delhi airport on Tuesday on a single engine. The airline said that the crew decided to tow the aircraft to the parking bay keeping in mind passenger safety and comfort. All the passengers are safe and the matter was reported to Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA).

83.title: China's BYD surpasses Tesla to become world's top-selling EV brand: Report
83.article_body: Chinese automaker BYD has reportedly surpassed Elon Musk's Tesla to become the world's top-selling electronic vehicle (EV) brand in the first half of 2022. While BYD sold 641,000 EVs between January and June this year, the figure stood at 564,000 for Tesla, Financial Times reported. Tesla's supply and production chain was disrupted after China imposed lockdowns due to COVID-19.

84.title: 76-million-year-old dinosaur skeleton to be auctioned in New York
84.article_body: A skeleton of a Gorgosaurus dinosaur that roamed on the earth about 76 million years ago will be auctioned for the first time, auction house Sotheby's announced. The Gorgosaurus skeleton will highlight Sotheby's natural history auction in New York on July 28, it added. The Gorgosaurus, an apex carnivore, predates its relative the Tyrannosaurus rex by 10 million years.

85.title: Launch of second version of Vande Bharat trains in Aug: Ashwini Vaishnaw
85.article_body: Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the Indian Railways will launch an upgraded second version of the semi-high-speed Vande Bharat trains in August 2022. "The first two trains started operating in 2019. So far, both the trains have travelled 14 lakh kilometres," he added. "Last year, 75 more trains [were] approved that are under production," Vaishnaw stated.

86.title: Hyderabad civic body raises awareness on mosquito-borne diseases
86.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has asked people to take steps to stop the spread of infectious and seasonal diseases during the monsoon season. The civic body is working to raise awareness on mosquito-borne illnesses. GHMC officials also conducted door-to-door fever examinations and carried out fogging operations.

87.title: India asks Sri Lanka to make advance payments for fuel: Report
87.article_body: India is seeking advance payments for fuel shipments to cash-strapped Sri Lanka amid the latter's ongoing economic crisis, Bloomberg has reported. India has already extended assistance worth $3.5 billion to Sri Lanka in form of supplies, including food and fuel. Sri Lanka needs $587 million to pay for fuel shipments, a minister had earlier said.

88.title: We've reached a stage where one can't say anything on religion: Tharoor on Mahua's remark
88.article_body: Following a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We've reached a stage where no one can say anything publicly about any aspect of religion without someone claiming to be offended." Tharoor said he was taken aback by the attack on Moitra as Hindus know that forms of worship vary across India.

89.title: Facing Djokovic at Wimbledon is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis: Norrie
89.article_body: World number 12 Cameron Norrie, who'll face Novak Djokovic in Wimbledon 2022 semi-final, has said facing Djokovic on grass is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis. "I'd say that grass is his favourite surface, and his track record is unbelievable...I will have to improve my level," he added. Djokovic is unbeaten in his last 26 matches at Wimbledon.

90.title: French engine maker Safran to set up MRO facility in Hyderabad
90.article_body: French engine maker Safran will set up a maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility in Hyderabad with investment of $150 million. The facility will be for LEAP-1A and LEAP-1B engines being used in aircraft by both Indian and foreign commercial airlines. The defence ministry said the MRO facility will be able to overhaul more than 250 engines per year initially.

91.title: Told Uddhav we aren't getting any benefit from MVA: CM Shinde
91.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed CM Eknath Shinde said that he had told former CM Uddhav Thackeray that they [Shiv Sena] are not getting any benefit from Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). "Despite our party's CM, we came at number four in Nagar Panchayat [polls]...We tried but we didn't succeed [in making him understand]," Shinde said on Wednesday.

92.title: Bus service from West Bengal's Siliguri to Kathmandu begins
92.article_body: State Transport Minister Firhad Hakim flagged off a bus service between Siliguri in West Bengal and Kathmandu in Nepal on Wednesday. The 40-seater bus will operate from Siliguri on Monday, Wednesday and Friday every week and will depart for Kathmandu at 3 pm. Tickets are available at ₹1,500 per person. The service will boost tourism in the region, officials said.

93.title: PM wishes 'long life & good health' to Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday
93.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday during a phone call on Wednesday. "We pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. The Tibetan spiritual leader, who has been living in exile in India after fleeing China in 1959, was also greeted by several other political leaders from the country.

94.title: Shanghai shuts karaoke venues after recent COVID-19 outbreak
94.article_body: KTV karaoke venues have been ordered to shut in Shanghai after a recent outbreak of COVID-19 from one such venue in the city. Cultural places like libraries will, however, be allowed to stay open. The cinemas and performance venues will also be allowed to reopen from Friday as per schedule, according to an official.

95.title: 4 drug peddlers arrested in B'luru; 70 grams of MDMA crystals seized
95.article_body: The Narcotics Squad of Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested four drug peddlers, who are said to be from Kerala, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Four iPhones and 70 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth ₹11 lakh, have been seized from their possession, Gupta added.

96.title: Toronto apologises after Sikh guards fired over 'no-beard policy'
96.article_body: Canada's Toronto has apologised to a prominent Sikh organisation for delay in reinstating Sikh security guards who were fired over 'no-beard policy'. Over 100 guards were terminated from several establishments after they were required to shave their beards so that they could wear N95 masks. City officials will allow 'under-mask beard covers' for people who wish to maintain facial hair.

97.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav to be shifted to Delhi, Bihar CM meets him at Patna hospital
97.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs, will be shifted to Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday met the RJD chief at Paras Hospital in Patna, where he has been admitted currently. "If situation calls for us to take him to Singapore, we will," Tejashwi added.

98.title: All in politics called to enquire about Lalu Yadav’s health: Tejashwi
98.article_body: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday said that everyone in politics, including Rahul Gandhi and PM Narendra Modi, called to enquire about the ex-CM's health condition. "Everyone knows about his kidney & heart issues for which treatment was going on in Delhi," he said. We're in this together, he added.

99.title: 'Kaali' film director's old tweet on PM Modi surfaces amid controversy over poster
99.article_body: Indian-born Canada-based filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 2013 tweet on PM Narendra Modi has resurfaced amid controversy over her film Kaali's poster. "I will surrender my passports, ration card, PAN card and my citizenship if ever Modi becomes this country's PM in my lifetime. I swear," she wrote. Sharing her tweet, filmmaker Ashoke Pandit said, "You've not stuck to your commitment."

100.title: Dutch university recovers $511,302 paid in ransom in 2019 hack
100.article_body: The University of Maastricht has recovered a ransom it paid in Bitcoin to hackers in 2019. The Netherlands Public Prosecution Service was able to seize cryptocurrencies worth approximately $511,302. "While it may seem like a lot of money, it is significantly less than the damage the university actually suffered as a result of the attack," the university said.

101.title: Ex-BJP worker, husband named in K'taka PSI exam scam first charge-sheet
101.article_body: A former BJP worker, Divya Hagaragi, and her husband have been named in the first charge-sheet filed in the Karnataka PSI exam scam case. The headmaster of a school, owned by Hagaragi, and three teachers at the school have also been named. The school served as an examination centre for the PSI recruitment exam in October 2021.

102.title: Fire breaks out at car showroom in Gurugram, 6 tenders rushed to spot
102.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a car showroom in Gurugram where two employees were trapped, officials said on Tuesday. Around six tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was doused within an hour. The incident took place when employees turned on an AC on the first floor. Records of the company, chairs and tables were destroyed.

103.title: Locals turn giant pothole into a 'beach' for protest in MP, pics go viral
103.article_body: Locals in the Anuppur district of Madhya Pradesh staged a unique protest by turning a giant pothole into a community 'beach'. Locals decorated the area around the pothole with flowers, placed benches and set up food stalls for the protest. The idea for the protest came after repeated requests to repair the run-down road elicited no response from the administration.

104.title: Nearly ₹15 crore raised for 2-yr-old boy orphaned in US mass shooting
104.article_body: Nearly $1,900,000 (₹15 crore) has been raised for the 2-year-old boy who was found wandering alone at the US Independence Day parade shooting site after his parents were killed in the massacre. Aiden was unharmed and was handed over to his grandparents. The GoFundMe page was established to help Aiden's family with "raising, caring for and supporting" him.

105.title: 9 govt school teachers in UP use fake documents to secure job, booked
105.article_body: Services of nine government primary school teachers were terminated in UP's Pratapgarh for allegedly using fake certificates to secure teaching posts, an official said. FIR was lodged against the teachers. The action was taken when an online verification of the TET documents of these teachers, appointed in October 2020, revealed that their qualifying certificates are fake, the official added.

106.title: India squad for ODI series against West Indies announced, Shikhar Dhawan named captain
106.article_body: Team India squad for the three-match ODI series against West Indies has been announced. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, while Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain. Shubman Gill, who last played an ODI in December 2020, has also been included in the 16-member squad. Ravindra Jadeja has been named vice-captain.

107.title: Everyone does everything together in the Kapoor family: Alia Bhatt
107.article_body: Discussing her experience as a part of the Kapoor family following her marriage to Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt said, "[I've] been brought up between me, my mum, my sister and my father...Our interaction was very limited." "We [didn't] have these massive celebrations...Everybody did their own thing...Enter the Kapoor family, where everyone does everything [like eating, aarti] together," added Alia.

108.title: Pair of Shinde, Fadnavis to make Maha prosper: Fadnavis' wife Amruta
108.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis said that the "ED pair", CM Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis, will make the state prosper with their hard work. "Difficult situations change but strong people always last," Amruta added. On Tuesday, state Deputy CM said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]."

109.title: Lt Gen Subramanian appointed as Force Commander of UN Mission in S Sudan
109.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has appointed Lieutenant General Mohan Subramanian of the Indian Army as his new Force Commander of the UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS). He succeeds Lieutenant General Shailesh Tinaikar of India. Subramanian "most recently...served as the General Officer Commanding, Military Region (Operational and Logistic Readiness Zone) in central India", the UN said.

110.title: For me, fitness is feeling good about myself: Anil Kapoor on staying fit at 65
110.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, in a new video, revealed his fitness routine at 65 and said that it included proper sleep and a balanced diet. "For me, fitness is feeling good about myself. I try and balance it with my workouts," he added. "My trainer Mark makes a plan...and I do exactly what he tells me to do," Anil said.

111.title: Amarnath Yatra resumes after suspension due to bad weather
111.article_body: A day after remaining suspended due to bad weather, Amarnath Yatra resumed on Wednesday morning, as another batch of 5,982 left from Jammu towards the Valley. "Of these 3,363 are going to Pahalgam base camp while 2,619 are going to Baltal base camp," officials said. Over 65,000 have visited the shrine this year since the yatra started on June 30.

112.title: 4 minor girls rescued from child labour in Telangana
112.article_body: Rachakonda Police rescued four minor girls aged between 11 and 17 from child labour in Mangalpally village of Telangana. The girls who were exploited illegally for labour work belong to Chhattisgarh. The accused was running a manufacturing company of disposable glasses and thermocol plates. He made the children work for over 12 hours and paid them ₹270 each per day.

113.title: Everyone would criticise me, they didn't know what I was facing: Arjun
113.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said "everyone would criticise" him at one point of time, adding that they didn't know what he was going through. Arjun stated that it was "tough emotionally" for him at one stage. "To everyone who trolled me, who criticised me, who hated me, I say thank you," he said. "I will...keep coming back for more," stated Arjun.

114.title: Is this cost of toppling Maharashtra govt: Congress on LPG price hike
114.article_body: All India Mahila Congress on Wednesday, while referring to the price hike of LPG cylinders, asked Centre if it was a cost of toppling the state government in Maharashtra. This comes days after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde won a confidence vote in the state Assembly. Notably, the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 on Wednesday.

115.title: 17-year-old boy kidnapped, stabbed to death by 4 men in Delhi
115.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four men for allegedly kidnapping and murdering a 17-year-old over personal enmity on July 1. The accused persons claimed that they were assaulted by the victim and his associates on June 29, following which they murdered him to seek revenge. Police said the accused told them they set the victim's body on fire before burying him.

116.title: 7 injured as vehicle falls into 150-feet deep gorge in J&K's Ramban
116.article_body: Seven people were injured after their vehicle fell into a 150-feet deep gorge in the Ramban district along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway on Wednesday. According to a police official, the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle following which it skidded off the road and plunged into the gorge. The accident took place near Kharpora village of Banihal, he added.

117.title: OPEC Secretary General Mohammad Barkindo passes away at 63
117.article_body: The Secretary General of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, Mohammad Barkindo, passed away at the age of 63 in Nigeria on Tuesday. "His passing is a profound loss to the entire OPEC Family, the oil industry and the international community," OPEC tweeted. Notably, Barkindo was scheduled to step down from the top post at the end of this month.

118.title: Dial 112 to make Teri Galliyan safer: UP Police makes 'Ek..' reference in tweet
118.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police took to Twitter to share a tweet about safety while making a reference to the movie 'Ek Villain Returns'. "Be Nobody's #Villaintine...because the only sequel to crime is prison! Dial 112 to make Teri Galliyan safer. #NoVillainReturns," the tweet from the police read. The police also shared a picture with the tweet.

119.title: Amazon agrees to take 2% stake in US meal delivery platform Grubhub
119.article_body: Amazon has agreed to take a stake in Just Eat Takeaway.com's US meal delivery platform Grubhub and will offer its US Prime users a one-year membership to the service. Just Eat Takeaway's shares have fallen 70% this year as shareholders demanded it sold Grubhub or found a partner for it. Amazon will have opportunity to increase the holding to 15%.

120.title: 2 groups clash over social media post on Nupur Sharma in Bihar
120.article_body: A fight broke out reportedly between two groups over a social media post on suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma in Bihar's Ara on Tuesday. The police reached the spot and detained the persons involved in the scuffle. According to the Ara DM, it was "a matter of a small fight between two youths".

121.title: White-ball captaincy is my priority, needs attention: Buttler on his Test career
121.article_body: England's newly-appointed white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said the question over his Test return doesn't have to be answered unless he's picked in the squad. "I was left out on merit and rightfully so...I'm not part of the team at the moment," stated Buttler. "Being captain of the white-ball team is my number one priority...that needs full-time attention," he added.

122.title: Tree branch falls on Thane civic body's Additional Commissioner's car
122.article_body: A tree branch fell on the car of Thane Municipal Corporation Additional Commissioner Sanjay Herwade on Tuesday amidst heavy rains. Herwade went to the Louiswadi area for inspection when the tree branch fell on his car. However, no one was injured in the incident as Herwade and his driver were out of the vehicle at the time of the incident.

123.title: HC stays bail granted to ex-Cong leader Sajjan Kumar in 1984 riots case
123.article_body: Delhi High Court stayed the order granting bail to former Congress leader Sajjan Kumar in a rioting and murder case in connection with the 1984 riots. HC sought Kumar's response to SIT's petition that challenged the bail. Notably, Kumar is already serving a life sentence in another case arising from the riots following the assassination of former PM Indira Gandhi.

124.title: 35-yr-old spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti shot in the head in Maharashtra
124.article_body: Spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, also known as 'Sufi Baba', was shot dead in Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday. The 35-year-old was shot in the head and died instantly, and the killers escaped in one of his SUVs, police said. Sayyad Chishti, who was from Afghanistan, had lived in Nashik's Yeola town for several years.

125.title: Shiv Sena wants me to contest Pune Lok Sabha seat: Shivajirao
125.article_body: Former Shirur MP Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil has said that the Shiv Sena has urged him to prepare himself to contest the Pune Lok Sabha seat in the next general election. He was expelled by the Shiv Sena for posting a message congratulating new CM Eknath Shinde last week. However, Shiv Sena withdrew the expulsion order the next day.

126.title: GMDA to use drone surveillance for traffic management in Gurugram
126.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority will start using drone technology for traffic management in Gurugram. The decision came following an increase in number of vehicles flouting norms and issues in traffic management. "The drone will also have a feature where it'll capture the vehicle's registration number plate and send a challan to those violating traffic rules online," an official said.

127.title: Shinde's wife plays drums as he reaches home 1st time after becoming CM
127.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's wife Lata Shinde played drums along with other musicians to welcome her husband home as he reached his residence first time after becoming the Chief Minister. In a video shared by news agency ANI, Lata can be seen smiling and playing drums. Several other people behind her can also be seen playing drums.

128.title: We need to prepare for complete cut-off of Russian gas: EU chief
128.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said that the 27 EU nations need to prepare for further disruption and "even a complete cut-off of Russian gas supply". The statement comes in view of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. Russia has already restricted its gas supplies to some European countries.

129.title: Insult of Hindu deities won't be tolerated: MP CM to Mahua Moitra
129.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that she has hurt Hindu religious sentiments. "Insult of Hindu deities will not be tolerated at any cost," Chouhan added. Meanwhile, a case was registered in Bhopal against Moitra for hurting religious sentiments.

130.title: ACB raids PMC official's properties, unearths assets worth ₹1 crore
130.article_body: Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) filed a case of disproportionate assets against Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official Vijay Bhaskar Landge and his wife on Tuesday after unearthing assets worth ₹1.02 crore. ACB conducted searches in properties linked to Landge in Pune and Nashik. ACB found documents of 5.5-acre agricultural land and other properties owned by Landge.

131.title: Andhra MP, CRPF personnel assault policeman in Hyderabad; booked
131.article_body: Rebel MP of Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSR Congress Party, K Raghu Rama Krishna Raju, his son, his personal assistant and two CRPF personnel were booked for allegedly assaulting a policeman in Hyderabad. The complainant alleged that he was attacked with sticks and forcibly carried in their car while on duty and was illegally confined in Raju's house for three hours.

132.title: Clay recycling campaign to be launched in Pune this Ganesha Chaturthi
132.article_body: In view of the Ganesha Chaturthi festival, several Pune-based organisations have decided to launch a clay recycling campaign in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal corporation areas. The clay sludge will be collected in residential societies, drop-off points across the city and at a few selected ghats. The clay will be transported to artists.

133.title: Bring it on BJP, I'm not afraid of police: Mahua on complaints over Goddess Kali remark
133.article_body: After the BJP filed several police complaints against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her remarks on Goddess Kali, she tweeted, "Bring it on BJP!" Moitra added, "Am a Kali worshipper. I am not afraid of anything. Not your ignoramuses. Not your goons. Not your police. And most certainly not your trolls." She also wrote, "Truth doesn't need back up forces."

134.title: Businessman forces wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi; booked
134.article_body: A Gurugram businessman has been booked for allegedly forcing his wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi. "If I refused...my husband would thrash and sexually abuse me," she alleged. The FIR was registered by UP Police after she approached a Muzaffarnagar court claiming she was intercepted by her husband's goons when she tried to approach Gurugram Police.

135.title: I'm suffering from character blindness: Rajamouli's cousin on Resul's tweet
135.article_body: Reacting to Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty calling RRR a 'gay love story', the film's director SS Rajamouli's cousin and music composer MM Keeravaani tweeted, "I [am now suffering]...from character blindness." "I am not able to see [actors Ram Charan] and...[Jr NTR's] characters from RRR anymore (who looked like having shared a special relationship)," he added on Twitter.

136.title: Punjab cabinet approves 300 units of free electricity to every household
136.article_body: The Punjab cabinet on Wednesday approved the decision to provide 300 units of free electricity to every household in the state. Taking to Twitter, CM Bhagwant Mann said, "We had guaranteed the people of Punjab that we will give 300 units electricity free of cost as soon as we form government. This decision has been approved by the cabinet today."

137.title: Water levels of 4 dams supplying water to Pune rise after continuous rains
137.article_body: Water levels of the four dams supplying water to Pune city are slowly rising following continuous rainfall in the catchment areas. The storage in Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar dams has reportedly reached 3.67 thousand million cubic feet (TMC). Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the water storage in the four dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

138.title: Daughter said 'Your Spice Girls skirts were too short, unacceptable': Victoria
138.article_body: Singer Victoria Beckham said that her daughter Harper Seven Beckham said that Victoria's skirts during her time with 'Spice Girls' were "unacceptable". "Harper actually said to me recently, 'Mummy, I've seen some pictures of you when you were in the Spice Girls, and your skirts...were just too short.' Then David piped up and said, 'Absolutely, Harper! They really...were'," she added.

139.title: Rishabh Pant can open for Team India in T20Is: Wasim Jaffer
139.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said the Team India management should think about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as an opener in T20Is. "I think that's the spot where Rishabh can blossom," added Jaffer. Pant smashed the fastest Test hundred by an Indian wicketkeeper in the fifth Test against England. He scored 146(111) in the first innings and 57(86) in the second.

140.title: BMC issues advisory amid rising dengue, malaria cases in Mumbai
140.article_body: Amid rising dengue and malaria cases in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has issued an advisory requesting citizens to take extra care and not ignore fever. Nearly 40 cases of gastro and malaria have been reported across Mumbai in the first three days of July. Zen Multi Speciality Hospital's Dr Vikrant Shah said, "[Viral] cases are...[rising]...due to sudden changes in...climate."

141.title: Several police complaints filed against Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali
141.article_body: Several police complaints have been filed against TMC MP Mahua Moitra by the BJP across West Bengal over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." After a controversy erupted over her statement on the goddess, she tweeted, "I never backed any film or poster or mentioned the word smoking."

142.title: SpiceJet issued show cause notice after 8 malfunction incidents in 18 days
142.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued a show cause notice to budget carrier SpiceJet after the airline reported eight malfunction incidents in last 18 days. It said that SpiceJet has "failed to establish safe, efficient and reliable air services". The Accountable Manager has been called upon to show cause within three weeks of receipt of the notice.

143.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to marry for the 2nd time tomorrow, pic of wife-to-be surfaces
143.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh on Thursday. It'll be his second marriage. He was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is likely to attend the wedding with his family. Bhagwant Mann has two children from his first marriage.

144.title: Was told 'Offer Rajkummar cup of tea, send him away': Hansal on 'Shahid'
144.article_body: Discussing his 2013 film 'Shahid', director Hansal Mehta said, "I wasn't ready to meet [actor Rajkummar Rao]. Anurag Kashyap and [casting director] Mukesh Chhabra told me to...meet him once." Hansal added that Chhabra later called him to inform him that Rajkummar was standing outside his office. "[He told me to]...offer a cup of tea and send Rajkummar away," stated Hansal.

145.title: Shardul is not the same bowler we saw 18 months back: Manjrekar
145.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said all-rounder Shardul Thakur wasn't as effective in the rescheduled fifth Test against England as he was a few months back. "Shardul is not the same bowler we saw in Test cricket maybe 18 months back," stated Manjrekar. Shardul had picked seven wickets in two Tests he played against England last year.

146.title: Delhi govt warns parents against misuse of CCTV footage of classrooms
146.article_body: The Delhi government has warned parents and guardians of children studying in its schools from sharing the CCTV footage of classrooms. Parents have reportedly been asked to take a pledge that they will not share the password of the mobile app used to access the footage. Notably, the project was launched by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in 2019.

147.title: Ukrainian Governor urges 3.5 lakh people to flee amid Russian offensive
147.article_body: Governor of Donetsk province, Pavlo Kyrylenko, urged over 3,50,000 residents to evacuate the province to save lives and to enable the Ukrainian army to better defend towns from the Russian onslaught. This comes after Russian forces struck targets across Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region on Tuesday, a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin declared victory in the neighbouring Luhansk province.

148.title: Blast at arms depot in Yemen kills at least 6, injures 32
148.article_body: At least six people were killed and 32 injured after a blast occurred at an arms depot in Yemen's Abyan province on Tuesday, said medical officials. Many of the wounded victims were said to be critical and the officials feared the death toll might rise. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

149.title: Minister, lawmaker resign from UK PM Johnson's government after Sunak, Javid's exit
149.article_body: British Minister for Children and Families Will Quince resigned on Wednesday, saying he was going after being given an "inaccurate" briefing over PM Boris Johnson's appointment of a politician who was subject of complaints. Lawmaker Laura Trott also stepped down from her role as Parliamentary Private Secretary to Department of Transport. This comes after Rishi Sunak and Sajid Javid's exit.

150.title: Meta sues individual who scraped data from 3.5 lakh Instagram profiles
150.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has sued Turkey-based individual, Ekrem Ateş, for using automated Instagram accounts to scrape data from the profiles of over 3.5 lakh Instagram users. The individual later published that data on a series of clone sites. Meta has also sued Octopus, a US subsidiary of a Chinese firm, that offers data scraping-for-hire services to individuals and companies.

151.title: Over 1,100 people died of TB in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad in last 2 years
151.article_body: According to the health authorities, more than 1,100 people have died of tuberculosis (TB) in the last two years in Pune city and Pimpri Chinchwad. There were 439 and 385 TB-related deaths in Pune in the year 2020 and 2021, respectively. Whereas in Pimpri-Chinchwad, 147 people succumbed to the infectious lung disease in 2020 and 162 died in 2021.

152.title: SC to hear anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against FIRs over Rahul Gandhi video
152.article_body: Supreme Court on July 7 will hear TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against multiple FIRs over clips on Rahul Gandhi. "Please list this urgently...otherwise, he'll be in repeated custody," his lawyer told SC. Noida Police arrested Ranjan in connection with clips purportedly misquoting Gandhi and linking his statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

153.title: Final construction on Delhi-Meerut Expressway to be completed in August: Official
153.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said that the rail overbridge, which is the final structure on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), is expected to be complete by mid-August. We will close down three exits in Vijay Nagar area after construction of the rail overbridge located at Chipyana Bujurg near Crossings Republik is completed, an NHAI official said.

154.title: Man gets ₹60,000 from mobile network operator after number gets blocked in Tamil Nadu
154.article_body: A consumer court has asked a mobile network operator to give ₹60,000 as compensation to a Tamil Nadu man after his number was blocked and allocated to another person without explanation. The court asked the operator to pay ₹25,000 for deficiency in service and ₹30,000 for loss of customer's contacts as well as causing mental agony.

155.title: UDF protests outside Kerala Assembly over minister's remarks on Constitution
155.article_body: The opposition UDF led by Congress on Wednesday held a protest outside Kerala Assembly against state minister Saji Cherian's remarks on the Indian Constitution. "What Cherian said is not acceptable and [CM Pinarayi] Vijayan should ask for his resignation," said VD Satheesan, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly. Notably, Cherian had said that the Constitution exploits working-class people.

156.title: Couldn't take decisions on Dawood Ibrahim, Mumbai blasts in MVA govt: Shinde
156.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said, "Shiv Sena, BJP contested 2019 Assembly elections together but...government was formed with Congress and NCP...whenever issues of Hindutva...Savarkar...Mumbai blasts...[and] Dawood came up...we were unable to take a decision." He also said, "We have decided to take our Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray's Hindutva ideology further."

157.title: 4 detained for making threat calls to people supporting Nupur Sharma in Amravati
157.article_body: Amravati Police detained four people for making threat calls to people who made social media posts in support of Nupur Sharma. The police also appealed to people to contact the nearest police station if someone threatens them over their posts on Nupur Sharma, said Amravati Police Commissioner Arti Singh. She added the details of the complainant will be kept confidential.

158.title: 37-yr-old man run over by bus after bumping into pothole in Thane
158.article_body: A 37-year-old man was run over by a state bus after his motorcycle bumped into a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The incident occurred at Ghodbunder Road when the man lost his balance after hitting the pothole and fell off the motorcycle. The victim was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead by doctors, reports said.

159.title: 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised in Jan-Feb 2023: CM
159.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said that a 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised from January 28 to February 26, 2023. "Heavy discounts will be offered. Entire Delhi will be decorated. Exhibitions will also be organised," he added. "I expect that in a few years, we will make it the biggest shopping festival in the world," Kejriwal further said.

160.title: Mahua unfollows TMC on Twitter after party condemns her remark on goddess Kaali
160.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has unfollowed the official Twitter handle of TMC. This comes after the party distanced itself from her remarks on goddess Kaali. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra said. Following her statement, TMC said, "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views…have been made in her personal capacity…AITC strongly condemns such comments."

161.title: India creating ecosystem to make social media accountable: Vaishnaw
161.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday called social media "a very powerful medium" that has a "big influence" on people's lives. "How to make it accountable has become a very valid question," Vaishnaw said. He added, "Everywhere across the globe and even in our country, an ecosystem, a thought process, is being created to make social media accountable."

162.title: Clear buys compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in all-cash deal
162.article_body: Fintech startup Clear, formerly known as ClearTax, has acquired compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in an all-cash deal, which was reportedly worth around ₹75 crore. As per a statement, CimplyFive will continue to run as an independent platform, led by its founder Shankar Jaganathan. Earlier this year, Clear acquired supply-chain financing company Xpedize for around ₹100 crore.

163.title: China-bound SpiceJet cargo plane returns over faulty weather radar, 3rd incident in 24 hrs
163.article_body: SpiceJet said its China-bound cargo plane returned to Kolkata on Tuesday as pilots realised after take-off that its weather radar wasn't working. It was the third incident of technical malfunction on a SpiceJet aircraft in 24 hours. Earlier on Tuesday, a Delhi-Dubai flight made emergency landing in Karachi over malfunctioning fuel indicator and a Kandla-Mumbai flight suffered a windshield crack.

164.title: Hard-fought series, competition was at its best: Jadeja on England Tests
164.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Twitter to share pictures from Edgbaston Test, which India lost by seven wickets. He wrote, "Always a great feeling to contribute for my team, even though we fell short. A hard-fought series where the competition was at its best." Jadeja scored his first overseas hundred in international cricket in the match.

165.title: Sinner had nothing to lose before match but lot to lose 2 sets up: Novak
165.article_body: Following his comeback win after losing the first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in Wimbledon, Novak Djokovic said, "Sinner had nothing to lose before the match, but...lot to lose when...two sets...up." "I could feel that on a mental level...If you're up against...players like Sinner, who...[are playing] their first quarter-final...those things play a role," he added.

166.title: Turning point was India losing 6 wickets for 55 runs in 3rd innings: Deep
166.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said the turning point of the fifth Test between India and England which the former lost by seven wickets, was India losing six wickets within 55 runs in the third innings. "We dominated the match for...first three days...We [could've] batted more carefully...An increase of 100 runs would have...reduced the overs for [the] final innings," added Deep.

167.title: Crypto sector has many business models, some are riskier: CoinSwitch CEO
167.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CEO Ashish Singhal took to Twitter to say, "Crypto industry has several business models. Some are inherently riskier than others and can come undone, as recent events have shown." His statement came after cryptocurrency exchange Vauld suspended trading, deposits and withdrawals citing "financial difficulties". He also discussed CoinSwitch's business model in his tweets.

168.title: Blinken unlikely to hold talks with Russian Foreign Min at G20: US
168.article_body: US State Department spokesman Ned Price said he doesn't expect State Secretary Antony Blinken to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in Bali. Price said he expects G20 members to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine. However, Blinken will meet Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi for a "candid exchange" on Beijing’s response to Ukraine war.

169.title: India has to manage its own interests: EAM Jaishankar on Ukraine war
169.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India has taken the "right course" on the Ukraine conflict and added that it is a very complex matter where the most urgent issue is to prevent hostilities from escalating. "We have historical interest, we have a strategic interest, we have current interests and we have to manage those interests," he added.

170.title: Thiruvananthapuram's Lulu mall to begin 'midnight shopping' concept on trial basis
170.article_body: Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram is set to introduce "midnight shopping" concept, state capital's first night-shopping model, on a trial basis from July 6. "Our main intention is...to ensure that public experience nightlife with less traffic, where they can purchase their daily needs in more peaceful atmosphere," Joy Shadanandan, Regional Director, Lulu group, said.

171.title: Man takes wrong turn using Google Maps in Gurugram, made to sweep road
171.article_body: A man in Gurugram has alleged that a constable made him sweep the road after he took a wrong turn as directed by Google Maps, which took him to a restricted area. "When I stepped out, he abused me," the man said, adding that the constable said he brought mud with tyres of the car. An inquiry has been initiated.

172.title: What is the story behind Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration against India?
172.article_body: England's Joe Root celebrated his Edgbaston Test hundred against India by wiggling his pinky finger. It was a reference to a scene from singer Elvis Presley's biopic 'Elvis'. In the movie, Elvis wiggles his little finger despite being ordered by police not to perform his signature movements. Root revealed Ben Stokes watched 'Elvis' and asked the team to be "rockstars".

173.title: Girl shares pics after her cheek was grazed by a bullet during US mass shooting
173.article_body: An 18-year-old girl has shared pictures of her injury after her cheek was grazed by a bullet in the US Independence Day parade mass shooting.
