348.article_body: HDFC Bank on Monday said it has received the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) approval for its potential merger with its parent company HDFC. "The RBI has accorded its 'no objection' for the scheme...subject to certain conditions," it stated. The merger, which received approval from BSE and NSE last week, remains subject to approvals from the CCI and the NCLT.

349.title: Tiger Shroff's mother shares pics showing his grandfather who fought in WWII at 18
349.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff's mother, Ayesha Shroff, on Tuesday shared pictures of her father who fought in World War II. "Tiger's grandfather training to fly Tiger Moths. I guess he was around 18 or 19...when he fought in World War II," she wrote. "Decorated for his bravery by his India. I'm proud to be his daughter. Jai Hind," Ayesha added.

350.title: Was on verge of alcoholism when 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work: Hansal
350.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has revealed that he was on the verge of becoming "a certified alcoholic" when his 2000 film 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work. "There was political backlash...I got depressed for 6-7 months...Luckily something snapped," he added. Hansal said he picked up the pieces and made 2002 film 'Chhal' and has never given up at the start.

351.title: We fell short with the bat on Day 4: Bumrah on India's loss at Edgbaston
351.article_body: After India lost the rescheduled fifth Test against England by seven wickets at Edgbaston, India stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah said his side fell short with the bat on Day 4. "And that is where we let the opposition in to let the match slip away from us," he added. India were bowled out for 245 in their second innings.

352.title: Indian tech startups can reach $200 bn revenue in 5 yrs: Chiratae Chairman
352.article_body: Indian technology startups have the potential to reach a revenue scale of $200 billion in the next five years, according to Chiratae Ventures Chairman Sudhir Sethi. In same time frame, at least 25 new-age technology companies will have a revenue of at least $1 billion each, he said. He added that venture equity capital is expected to grow about 10%.

353.title: India slip below Pakistan in World Test Championship standings after points penalty
353.article_body: India have slipped below Pakistan in the World Test Championship (WTC) standings after being penalised for slow over-rate against England in Edgbaston Test. After being docked two points, India are now fourth on WTC points table with 52.08% of points won, while Pakistan are third with 52.38% of points won. India have also been fined 40% of their match fee.

354.title: 8-member SIT to probe security breach at Bengal CM's home in Kolkata
354.article_body: Kolkata Police has constituted an eight-member Special Investigation Team to probe the security breach at West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's residence. A man was arrested for allegedly sneaking into the CM's residence in Kalighat on July 3. The man told the police that he did so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters.

355.title: TMC condemns MP Mahua's 'Kaali is meat-eating, alcohol-accepting goddess for me' remark
355.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary film 'Kaali', TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." TMC distanced itself from her remarks. "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views expressed on Goddess Kali have been made in her personal capacity...All India Trinamool Congress strongly condemns such comments," it tweeted.

356.title: We first thought 'Tu Cheez...' will look cheap: Shabbir Boxwala
356.article_body: Filmmaker Shabbir Boxwala said the team of 1994 film 'Mohra' thought that 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' will look cheap. He added lyricist Anand Bakshi said it's about alcohol and won't be degrading to the girl. Shabbir further said they had a tie-up with Bagpiper but they backed out, adding the Bagpiper person later called it his life's biggest mistake.

357.title: There was total belief while chasing down 378-run target at Edgbaston: Root
357.article_body: England batter Joe Root said there was absolute clarity and total belief while his side was chasing down the 378-run target in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Absolutely didn't think of stepping away from the game," he added. Root, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series', scored 142* in the fourth innings. England beat India by seven wickets.

358.title: Ranveer to reprise Mukesh Khanna's role in 'Shaktimaan' remake: Reports
358.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh will reportedly enter into Mukesh Khanna's shoes and play the character of 'Shaktimaan' on the silver screen. According to reports, Mukesh Khanna's Bheeshm International had announced the remake of the classic superhero show 'Shaktimaan'. Reports added, Ranveer showed a keen interest in playing Shaktimaan and makers too feel he can bring a natural charisma to the character.

359.title: Bengal has turned into pile of explosives: LoP Suvendu writes to Amit Shah
359.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, on Tuesday said, "The state has turned into a...pile of explosives." Adhikari also demanded an investigation by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the "alarming situation in the state". Adhikari claimed a man died when the crude bomb he was making exploded.

360.title: Govt to earn ₹94,800 crore from windfall tax on domestic crude oil: Moody's
360.article_body: The government will generate close to $12 billion (₹94,800 crore) of additional revenue from windfall taxes on domestic crude oil production and fuel exports, as per an estimate by Moody's Investors Service. The tax increase will reduce profits of Reliance Industries and ONGC, it added. Last week, the government imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne charge on domestically produced crude oil.

361.title: Platforms have right to court, but must follow our laws: MoS IT amid Twitter lawsuit
361.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said all foreign internet platforms have the right to court and judicial review in India. "But equally all...platforms operating here...have unambiguous obligation to comply with our laws," he tweeted. While Chandrasekhar didn't name any intermediary, the remarks come after reports of Twitter suing the government over content takedown orders.

362.title: US State Secy to meet Chinese Foreign Minister in Bali this week
362.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will hold talks with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali this week, the State Department said. The talks will be held on the sidelines of G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting. Reportedly, the announcement comes as US President Joe Biden is considering scrapping tariffs on a range of Chinese goods to curb inflation in America.

363.title: Delhi records 32 cases of dengue in June, 143 so far this year
363.article_body: Delhi reported 32 cases of dengue in June, taking the tally of total dengue cases in the national capital to 143 so far this year, as per MCD data released on Monday. According to the data, no deaths have been reported due to the infection this year. In 2021, Delhi recorded 9,613 cases, the highest in last five years.

364.title: Delhi HC orders setting up of 42 commercial courts within 6 months
364.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday ordered the setting up of 42 commercial courts in the next six months for the speedy redressal of cases. The court also directed the administration to file an affidavit disclosing availability of judicial officers who could man these commercial courts. The court granted the petitioner permission to re-approach if the order was not complied with.

365.title: Ms Marvel character is special, stands for representation: Director
365.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy has said that the character is special because it stands for representation. Ms Marvel, portrayed by Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, is Marvel's first South-Asian superhero. Sharmeen further said, "As a Pakistani filmmaker, it is a dream to be able to bring the character to life...'Ms Marvel' has something for everyone."

366.title: S Arabia allows 1 mn hajj pilgrims in biggest turnout since pandemic
366.article_body: Saudi Arabia will welcome one million hajj pilgrims this year, including 8,50,000 persons from abroad, in the biggest turnout in two years since COVID-19 pandemic broke out. The vaccinated pilgrims, aged below 65 years, will attend the hajj under strict sanitary conditions with the Masjid al-Haram being disinfected 10 times a day. In 2019, about 2.5 million people performed hajj.

367.title: Nine killed as passenger bus falls 40 metres in Nepal
367.article_body: At least nine people were killed after a passenger bus lost control and plunged 40 metres in central Nepal's Bagmati province on Tuesday, officials said. The bus, which was en route to Kathmandu, was carrying 40 passengers at the time. The cause of the accident is being ascertained and injured persons have been sent to a local hospital, police said.

368.title: Varun Dhawan & Janhvi wrap Bawaal schedule in Amsterdam: Reports
368.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala and filmmaker Nitesh Tiwari announced their new project 'Bawaal', starring Varun Dhawan & Janhvi Kapoor, in March 2022. The film went on the floor recently and now, the two actors have wrapped the Amsterdam schedule. Janhvi took to Instagram to share a photo with Varun. The team will now head to Poland for the next stint.

369.title: Assam hit by 3.7 magnitude earthquake
369.article_body: Assam was hit by a 3.7 magnitude earthquake on Tuesday at 11:03am, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to the data provided by the government agency, the epicentre of the earthquake was located at a depth of 35 km. The agency has also recorded more than 20 earthquakes occurring off the coast of Andaman & Nicobar Islands since Sunday.

370.title: 20 students fall sick after eating meal at school in Telangana
370.article_body: Around 20 students of the Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) in Telangana's Adilabad allegedly fell sick after they consumed the food served under mid-day meal scheme on Monday. Parents claimed that after eating the food, students began to vomit and were taken to Bhainsa Area Hospital. "We've already voiced our complaints to higher officials," parents said.

371.title: Fuel, electricity should be brought under GST ambit: CII President
371.article_body: The Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President and Bajaj Finserv Chairman Sanjiv Bajaj on Tuesday told PTI that items like electricity and fuel should be brought under the GST ambit. "[It]  will further help simplify, cut costs...[and] make industry more competitive," he stated. He added that the number of tax slabs under the GST should be brought down to three.

372.title: He humiliated the Constitution: MoS MEA on Kerala Minister's remarks
372.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan over his comments regarding the Indian Constitution, calling it an anti-national statement. "Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan humiliated the Indian constitution in his speech," Muraleedharan said. Cheriyan allegedly said that Indian Constitution is written in a manner that can be used to exploit people.

373.title: NATO countries sign off accession protocols for Sweden, Finland
373.article_body: The 30 member-countries of NATO have approved the accession protocols to include Sweden and Finland into its military grouping, in a move to further strategically isolate Russia. However, there remains uncertainty over Parliamentary approval from Turkey, which could still hinder the joining process. Turkey has demanded the Nordic nations to extradite "terrorists" linked to outlawed Kurdish groups.

374.title: Mumbai woman sends ₹7 lakh to wrong account, beneficiary says 'won lottery'
374.article_body: Cybercrime officials in Mumbai helped a woman get back ₹7 lakh, which she had mistakenly transferred to the wrong beneficiary bank account. A man, who received the money, initially claimed the amount was disbursed to him as part of a lottery win. "He failed to prove the claims. After much persuasion, he finally reversed the transaction," an official said.

375.title: Man kills 30-year-old wife over extramarital affair in Delhi; held
375.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 30-year-old wife over an extramarital affair in Delhi's Rohini, a police official said on Tuesday. Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal said they received the information about the murder on July 3, adding that after reaching the spot, they found the woman, wrapped in a bedsheet, lying on the floor. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused husband.

376.title: 15 fishermen missing after boat sinks off eastern Indonesia
376.article_body: Search is underway for the 15 fishermen who went missing on Saturday after their boat sank in the Arafura Sea off the coast of eastern Indonesia, authorities said Tuesday. "Ten people have been rescued safely, but 15 others remain missing," a spokesman of the Indonesian rescue services stated. He added that a navy warship would join the search on Tuesday.

377.title: Video shows Tesla car on Autopilot trying to turn in front of an oncoming tram in US
377.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla car on Autopilot making an attempt to turn directly in front of an oncoming tram in US. In the video, the car moved to make the turn as soon as the traffic light turned green, without waiting for the tram to pass by. However, the driver immediately intervened, saying, "That's not okay."

378.title: 'Kaali' director booked in Delhi for poster of goddess smoking cigarette
378.article_body: Delhi Police has registered a case against Leena Manimekalai, the director of documentary 'Kaali', over a poster showing the goddess smoking cigarette. "Prima facie, the content appeared promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and race," police said. It added the post was released on social media at a strategic time which is likely to entice religious sentiments.

379.title: Crypto lender Nexo offers to buy Vauld after it pauses operations
379.article_body: London-based crypto lender Nexo has signed an indicative term sheet with fellow lender Vauld that could potentially result in it acquiring the Singapore-based firm. Upon successful completion of the transaction, Nexo plans to acquire up to 100% stake in Vauld. This comes a day after Vauld suspended all operations on its platform citing "volatile market conditions" among other reasons.

380.title: 1,349 unlicensed weapons seized ahead of polls for urban bodies in MP
380.article_body: Authorities have seized 1,349 unlicensed weapons ahead of polls for urban local bodies in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. More than 2.58 lakh licensed arms holders deposited their weapons at their nearest police stations and preventive action had been taken against over 1.73 lakh persons, the official added. The polls will be held on July 6 and July 13.

381.title: Taliban govt to approach India regarding visas for Afghan students
381.article_body: The Taliban administration in Afghanistan has said that it will request India to issue visas to Afghan students enrolled in Indian educational institutes. The announcement was made by Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi after a meeting with Afghan students in Kabul on Monday, an official said. India recently reopened its embassy in Kabul but hasn't formally recognised Taliban government.

382.title: Hurt by turn of events, but will make Sena stronger: Uddhav
382.article_body: Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray has said that he was "hurt" to see some members ditching the party despite getting benefits and will visit Hingoli soon. Thackeray told Sena workers that it was painful to see MLAs and ministers, who won because of Sena workers and got everything (positions in the party) have left him.

383.title: Aurangzeb & Akbar responsible for inflation, unemployment: Owaisi
383.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government and said that Aurangzeb and Akbar are responsible for inflation, fuel price hike and unemployment and not PM Narendra Modi. "If children don't have jobs, then emperor Akbar is responsible," he said. "Had Taj Mahal not been built, petrol would have cost just ₹40 per litre," he added.

384.title: FIR against Ajmer Dargah cleric who offered to gift his house to whoever beheads Nupur
384.article_body: Rajasthan Police has filed an FIR against Ajmer Sharif Dargah cleric Salman Chishti after a video showed him offering to gift his house to anyone who beheads suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her remark on Prophet Muhammad. Dargah Station House Officer Dalveer Singh Faujdar said efforts are on to trace the 'khadim'. He said Salman has a criminal background.

385.title: Special win by England in 5th Test to level the series vs India: Tendulkar
385.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate England on their seven-wicket win in rescheduled fifth Test against India. "Special win by England to level...series. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow have been in sublime form and made batting look very easy," he wrote. Root(142*) and Bairstow(114*) both hit centuries in fourth innings to help England draw the five-match series 2-2.

386.title: Indian Constitution written in a way that can exploit people: Kerala minister
386.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian, while addressing a recent political programme, allegedly said, "The Constitution of the country has been written in such a manner that can be used to exploit the maximum number of people." Retired Kerala High Court judge BK Pasha has reportedly sought Cherian's resignation from CM Pinarayi Vijayan. CM Vijayan has asked Cherian to give an explanation.

387.title: Windshield cracks on Guj-Mumbai flight in 2nd SpiceJet incident today, plane lands safely
387.article_body: A SpiceJet aircraft, flying from Kandla in Gujarat to Mumbai in Maharashtra, suffered a crack on its outer windshield and made an emergency landing in Mumbai. This is the second incident in the day where a SpiceJet plane had to make an emergency landing. All passengers and crew members are safe, the airline said in a statement.

388.title: Ours is a govt where nobody will be insulted: Maharashtra CM Shinde
388.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said, "Ours is a government of common people. Ours is a government where nobody will be insulted." "Every community will be respected and taken forward...The state will be taken forward and the process of development will be taken forward," he added. Notably, Shinde-led state government won the floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday.

389.title: Working with Kangana Ranaut in 'Simran' was a massive mistake: Hansal Mehta
389.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta talked about his experience of working with Kangana Ranaut in the film 'Simran' and admitted that working with her was a "massive mistake". Speaking to Mashable India, Hansal agreed that she is a good actress but also said they didn't gel with each other. He further said they had only shot what she wanted to shoot.

390.title: How does the WTC points table read after England's historic run chase against India?
390.article_body: After defeating India by recording their highest successful chase (378 runs) in Test cricket in the rescheduled fifth Test, England are seventh on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 33.33% of points won. Meanwhile, India are third with 53.47% of points won. The table is led by Australia, who have accumulated 77.78% of points won.

391.title: To me, Kaali is a meat-eating & alcohol-accepting goddess: Mahua
391.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary 'Kaali' that shows the goddess smoking, TMC's Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "You have the freedom to imagine your goddess." "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," she added. Moitra said there are some places where alcohol is offered to gods and in some other places it would be blasphemy.

392.title: CCTV footage of the moment Amravati chemist was murdered surfaces
392.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced weeks after the murder of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, showing Kolhe surrounded by his killers before being attacked. Kolhe was stabbed to death by two men on a motorcycle on his way back from his medical shop. Kolhe was killed on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma.

393.title: WhatsApp posts supporting Nupur forwarded on group by Amravati chemist surface
393.article_body: Some of the WhatsApp texts forwarded by Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, who was killed over WhatsApp forwards supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, have been accessed by media. Kolhe reportedly forwarded messages supporting PM Narendra Modi and Nupur on a group called "Black Freedom". His post supporting Nupur was reportedly shared by his friend Yusuf Khan to other WhatsApp groups.

394.title: It was the biggest challenge for me to play Mithali: Taapsee
394.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that playing former Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj was the biggest challenge thrown at her in 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I'm anything but her in terms of demeanour. I took notice of her from her journey beyond cricket," she added. Taapsee further said that their ideologies are similar which helped them get along really well.

395.title: Rishi Kapoor was flamboyant & loud, Ranbir is complete opposite: Karan Malhotra
395.article_body: Director Karan Malhotra, who directed Ranbir Kapoor in 'Shamshera' and his late father, actor Rishi Kapoor in 'Agneepath', said that he has been fortunate to work with both of them. Elaborating on their differences, Karan said, "Chintu uncle was...very flamboyant, loud...and confrontational person." "Ranbir is the complete opposite...[He] is happy-go-lucky. He does his masti quietly," Karan added.

396.title: Absolutely listless: Sehwag on India's bowling in 4th innings of 5th Test
396.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said India's bowling in fourth innings of the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston was "absolutely listless" following the visitors' seven-wicket loss. India managed to take three wickets in fourth innings. While Alex Lees was run out, Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope were dismissed by Jasprit Bumrah. "India have quite a few issues to address," Sehwag added.

397.title: India has signed MoUs to make UPI available in 3 countries: Vaishnaw
397.article_body: India has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Singapore, UAE and France to make Unified Payments System (UPI) available in these countries, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. Addressing the inauguration of Digital India Week 2022, he added that India is currently in talks with 30 nations. Further, he stated that UPI has helped in avoiding the creation of monopolies.

398.title: Shiv Sena still hopeful of rebel MLAs' return to party: Sanjay Raut
398.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that the party is "still hopeful" of the rebel MLAs' return to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's side. "They are our people, will come back. 'Subha ka bhoola agar shaam ko ghar aa jaye to usse bhoola nahi kehte'," he said. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's," he added.

399.title: Will work round the clock to make Maha number 1 state: Fadnavis
399.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis held a road-show in Nagpur on Tuesday. During the road-show he said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]." "We'll [Eknath Shinde-led state government] not only complete these 2.5 years in power, but will also form a government with a majority for the next five years," he added.

400.title: Cong workers put paper boats on Indore streets to protest against floods
400.article_body: Congress workers on Tuesday put paper boats on the waterlogged streets of Indore to protest against flooding concerns after heavy showers. A video of these party workers holding placards with scripted messages for Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also surfaced online. Notably, urban local body polls will be held in Indore and Bhopal on July 6.

401.title: Nation wouldn't be in turmoil had PM, Shah appealed for peace: Baghel
401.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over Nupur Sharma's comments, asserting that turmoil across the country could be avoided if PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah appealed for peace. He also took a jibe at BJP-ruled states and said that there haven't been proceedings in a single state where BJP was in power.

402.title: President Kovind calls Assam CM, enquires about flood situation
402.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday called Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and enquired about the prevailing flood situation in the state and the ongoing relief and rescue operations. "Extremely grateful for his concern. It'll boost our morale in overcoming this situation," Sarma tweeted. He said he was honoured to receive a call from the President.
